code: @Manual{,   title = {f1dataR: F1 Data in R},   author = {Santiago Casanova},   year = {2022},   note = {https://scasanova.github.io/f1dataR, https://github.com/scasanova/f1dataR}, }

title: F1 Data in R
text: R package access Formula 1 Data Ergast API official F1 data stream via fastf1 python library.

title: F1 Data in R
text: Data pulled : Ergast API F1 Data Stream via Fast F1 python library

title: F1 Data in R
text: load_laps(season = 'current', race = 'last') function loads lap--lap time data drivers given season round. Round refers race number. defaults current season last race. Lap data limited 1996-present. Example:

title: F1 Data in R
text: get_driver_telemetry(season = 'current', race = 'last', session = 'R', driver, fastest_only = FALSE) parameters season (four digit year), race (number GP name), session (FP1. FP2, FP3, Q R), driver code (three letter code) entered, function load data session pull info selected driver. first time session called, loading times relatively long subsequent calls improve couple seconds
code: get_driver_telemetry(2022, 4, driver = 'PER') #> The first time a session is loaded, some time is required. Please be patient. Subsequent times will be faster #> # A tibble: 42,415 × 18 #>    Date                SessionTime DriverAhead DistanceToDriverAhead #>    <dttm>              <dttm>      <chr>                       <dbl> #>  1 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          ""                         0.0889 #>  2 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          ""                         0.0889 #>  3 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          ""                         0.0889 #>  4 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          "6"                        0.0889 #>  5 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          "6"                        0.0593 #>  6 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          "6"                        0.0296 #>  7 2022-04-24 08:03:03 NA          "77"                       0      #>  8 2022-04-24 08:03:04 NA          "77"                       0.0222 #>  9 2022-04-24 08:03:04 NA          "6"                        0.0444 #> 10 2022-04-24 08:03:04 NA          "6"                        0.0444 #> # … with 42,405 more rows, and 14 more variables: Time <dttm>, RPM <dbl>, #> #   Speed <dbl>, nGear <dbl>, Throttle <dbl>, Brake <lgl>, DRS <dbl>, #> #   Source <chr>, RelativeDistance <dbl>, Status <chr>, …  get_driver_telemetry(2018, 7,'Q', 'HAM', fastest_only = T) #> The first time a session is loaded, some time is required. Please be patient. Subsequent times will be faster #> # A tibble: 534 × 18 #>    Date                SessionTime DriverAhead DistanceToDriverAhead #>    <dttm>              <dttm>      <chr>                       <dbl> #>  1 2018-06-09 13:59:18 NA          ""                           383. #>  2 2018-06-09 13:59:18 NA          ""                           383. #>  3 2018-06-09 13:59:18 NA          ""                           383. #>  4 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          383. #>  5 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          379. #>  6 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          375. #>  7 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          370. #>  8 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          366. #>  9 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          362. #> 10 2018-06-09 13:59:19 NA          "7"                          358. #> # … with 524 more rows, and 14 more variables: Time <dttm>, RPM <dbl>, #> #   Speed <dbl>, nGear <dbl>, Throttle <dbl>, Brake <lgl>, DRS <dbl>, #> #   Source <chr>, RelativeDistance <dbl>, Status <chr>, …

title: F1 Data in R
text: load_pitstops(season = 'current', race ='last') load_drivers(season = 2022) load_schedule(season = 2022) load_standings(season = 'current', round = 'last', type = c('driver', 'constructor')) load_results(season = 'current', round = 'last') load_quali(season = 'current', round = 'last') plot_fastest(season = 'current', race = 'last', driver, color = 'gear')

title: F1 Data in R
text: clear_f1_cache() Clears cache functions package.

title: F1 Data in R
text: package also includes static data frame current drivers respective constructors. Complete team colors, logo driver number logo.

title: Clear f1fastR Cache — clear_f1_cache
text: Clears cache f1dataR telemetry.

title: Load Driver Info (not cached) — .load_drivers
text: Loads driver info participants given season. funtion export, cached version.

title: Load Driver Info (not cached) — .load_drivers
text: season number 1950 2022 (defaults current season).

title: Load Driver Info (not cached) — .load_drivers
text: dataframe columns driverId (unique recurring), first name, last name, nationality, date birth (yyyy-mm-dd format), driver code, permanent number (post-2014 drivers).

what: Load Lap by Lap Time Data (not cached) — .load_laps
title: Load Lap by Lap Time Data (not cached) — .load_laps
text: Loads lap--lap time data drivers given season round. Lap time data available 1996 onwards. funtion export, cached version.

title: Load Lap by Lap Time Data (not cached) — .load_laps
Load Lap by Lap Time Data (not cached) — .load_laps
text: season number 1996 2022 (defaults current season) race number 1 23 (depending season selected) defaults recent

title: Load Lap by Lap Time Data (not cached) — .load_laps
text: dataframe columns driverId (unique recurring), position lap, time (clock form), lap number, time (seconds), season.

title: Load Pitstop Data (not cached) — .load_pitstops
text: Loads pit stop info (number, lap, time elapsed) given race season. Pit stop data available 2012 onwards. funtion export, cached version.

title: Load Pitstop Data (not cached) — .load_pitstops
text: season number 2012 2022 (defaults current season). race number 1 23 (depending season selected) defaults recent.

title: Load Pitstop Data (not cached) — .load_pitstops
text: dataframe columns driverId, lap, stop (number), time (day), stop duration

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_quali
text: Loads qualifying session results given season round.

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_quali
text: season number 1950 2022 (defaults current season). round number 1 23 (depending season), defaults recent.

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_quali
text: dataframe columns driverId, obtained position, Q1, Q2, Q3 times clock format well seconds.

title: Load Results (not cached) — .load_results
text: Loads final race resuts given year round.

title: Load Results (not cached) — .load_results
text: season number 1950 2022 (defaults current season). round number 1 23 (depending season), defaults recent.

title: Load Results (not cached) — .load_results
text: dataframe columns driverId, grid position, laps completed, race status (finished otherwise), gap first place, fastest lap rank, fastest lap time, fastest lap seconds, top speed kph.

title: Load Schedule (not cached) — .load_schedule
text: Loads schedule information given F1 season. funtion export, cached version.

title: Load Schedule (not cached) — .load_schedule
text: season number 1950 2022 (defaults current season).

title: Load Schedule (not cached) — .load_schedule
text: dataframe columns season, round, circuitId, circuitName, latitute Longitude, locality (city usually), country, date, time race.

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_standings
text: Loads qualifying session results given season round.

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_standings
text: season number 1950 2022 (defaults current season). round number 1 23 (depending season), defaults recent. type select drivers constructors championship data. Defaluts drivers

title: Load Qualifying Results (not cached) — .load_standings
text: dataframe columns driverId (constructorId), position, points, wins constructorsId case drivers championship.

what: Load Telemetry Data for a Driver — get_driver_telemetry
title: Load Telemetry Data for a Driver — get_driver_telemetry
text: Recieves season, race number, driver code, optional fastest lap argument output car telemetry selected situation.

title: Load Telemetry Data for a Driver — get_driver_telemetry
code: get_driver_telemetry(   season = "current",   race = "last",   session = "R",   driver,   fastest_only = FALSE )

title: Load Telemetry Data for a Driver — get_driver_telemetry
text: season number 2018 2022 (defaults current season). race number 1 23 (depending season selected) defaults recent. Also accepts race name. driver three letter driver code (see load_drivers() list) fastest_only boolean value whether pick laps fastest driver session.

title: Load Telemetry Data for a Driver — get_driver_telemetry
text: dataframe telemetry data selected driver/session.

title: Plot Fastest Lap — plot_fastest
text: Creates ggplot object details fastest lap driver race. Complete gearshift speed analysis.

title: Plot Fastest Lap — plot_fastest
code: plot_fastest(   season = "current",   race = "last",   session = "R",   driver,   color = "gear" )

title: Plot Fastest Lap — plot_fastest
text: season number 2018 2022 (defaults current season). race number 1 23 (depending season selected) defaults recent. driver three letter driver code (see load_drivers() list) color argument indicates variable plot overtop circuit

title: Plot Fastest Lap — plot_fastest
text: ggplot object indicates grand prix, driver, time selected color variable.
